sen.j: 大名貸（だいみょうがし）とは、大坂・京都・江戸などの有力商人によって財政窮乏に苦しむ大名（藩）に対して行われる金融のこと。
sen.e: Daimyogashi is loan arranged for Daimyo (Japanese feudal lords) and Han (their domain) in financial droughts by influential merchants in Osaka, Kyoto, Edo, and so on.
The term "daimyogashi" refers to a loan for a daimyo (Japanese feudal lords) or a domain in financial droughts arranged by influential merchants in Osaka, Kyoto, Edo, and so on.
sen.cmt: 冒頭に用語の説明とわかるように語句を追加、「arranged」の位置を変更、and をorに変更、Hanをdomainに変更しました。
sen.e: The term "daimyogashi" refers to a loan for a daimyo (Japanese feudal lords) or a domain in financial droughts arranged by influential merchants in Osaka, Kyoto, Edo, and so on.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、自領内の商人からの融資については御用金の名目で行われていたため、大名貸の範疇には含まれないとされている。
sen.e: Meanwhile, financing from the merchants in the own domain is not categorized as Daimyogashi, as it is done in the name of goyokin, the tax Daimyo imposed temporarily on famers and merchants.

Meanwhile, financing from merchants in their own domain was not categorized as Daimyogashi, as it was done under the name of goyokin (the money the Edo bakufu charged temporarily on farmers and merchants).
sen.cmt: 冠詞の修正、「御用金」の訳を用語集のものに修正、時制の修正しました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, financing from merchants in their own domain was not categorized as Daimyogashi, as it was done under the name of goyokin (the money the Edo bakufu charged temporarily on farmers and merchants).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 江戸時代における藩の経済は表向きは兵農分離と石高制の原則に基づいた自給自足的な体制（藩アウタルキー）によって運営されていたが、実際の幕藩体制において、全ての物資を自給自足可能な藩は存在しなかった。
sen.e: Even though the economy of Han in Edo period is ostensibly operated by subsistence economy system (the Han Autarkies) which is based on the principle of heinobunri (separation of the warrior class from the soil) and system of Kokudaka (tax system based on rice), it was impossible for any Han to be self-sufficient in all supplies.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Even though the economy of a domain during the Edo period was ostensibly operated by subsistence economy system (the Han Autarkies) which was based on the principle of heinobunri (separation of the warrior class from the soil) and the Kokudaka system (tax system based on rice), it was impossible for any domains to be self-sufficient in all supplies.
sen.cmt: Hanをdomainに修正、冠詞の追加しました。「一原文一訳文の例外対処」のコメントが抜けています
sen.e: Even though the economy of a domain during the Edo period was ostensibly operated by subsistence economy system (the Han Autarkies) which was based on the principle of heinobunri (separation of the warrior class from the soil) and the Kokudaka system (tax system based on rice), it was impossible for any domains to be self-sufficient in all supplies.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 加えて参勤交代や御用普請などの公儀（江戸幕府）の命令に基づく事業を遂行するためには、全国的な貨幣である幕府発行正貨の調達と中央市場への依存が不可欠であった。
sen.e: In addition, it was essential to procure national currency issued by the Edo bakufu (feudal government headed by a shogun) and dependence on the central market, in order to accomplish projects ordered by bakufu such as Sankinkotai (a system under which daimyo were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) and Goyofushin (civil engineering works ordered by Bakufu).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition, it was essential to procure national currency issued by the Edo bakufu (feudal government headed by a shogun) and to depend on the central market, in order to accomplish projects ordered by the bakufu such as Sankinkotai (a system under which daimyo were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) and Goyofushin (civil engineering works ordered by the bakufu).
sen.cmt: 文法の誤りを修正しました。（dependenceをto dependに）、冠詞の追加しました。
sen.e: In addition, it was essential to procure national currency issued by the Edo bakufu (feudal government headed by a shogun) and to depend on the central market, in order to accomplish projects ordered by the bakufu such as Sankinkotai (a system under which daimyo were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) and Goyofushin (civil engineering works ordered by the bakufu).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そこで、藩は年貢米や特産品を江戸や大坂にて売却してその代金（幕府発行正貨）あるいはそれをもって購入した必要物資を国許あるいは江戸屋敷に送金して経費にあてた。
sen.e: Therefore, Han sold their annual rice tax or local special products in Edo and Osaka and earned the national currency issued by bakufu, or sometimes purchased necessary goods with the money earned, which were sent to their hometown or their residence in Edo and spent as expense.

Therefore, a domain sold their annual rice tax and their local special products in Edo and Osaka to earn national currency issued by the bakufu, or they sometimes purchased necessary goods with the earned money, and they sent such money or those goods to their hometown or their residence in Edo to set aside for their expenses.
sen.cmt: Hanをdomainに、語順の訂正、冠詞の追加、文法の訂正（不要な関係代名詞の削除等）しました。
sen.e: Therefore, a domain sold their annual rice tax and their local special products in Edo and Osaka to earn national currency issued by the bakufu, or they sometimes purchased necessary goods with the earned money, and they sent such money or those goods to their hometown or their residence in Edo to set aside for their expenses.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: こうした取引は循環的かつ継続的に毎年繰り返されるが、正貨獲得時期と正貨支出時期が一致するとは限らず、正貨獲得以前に支出を要する場合には、販売予定の年貢米や特産品を担保として有力商人（特に蔵屋敷に出入りする蔵元や掛屋）から金銀を借りて、実際に入ってきた年貢米や特産品をもって返済することになる。
sen.e: As the timing of inflow and outflow of specie money do not always match despite such business were done every year cyclically and successively, when expense is needed before attaining the current money, it was unavoidable to borrow gold and silver from powerful merchants (especially Kuramoto; sake brewer, or kakeya; merchants dealing in finance) using the annual rice tax or local special products which were to be sold later as collateral and repay when they were actually delivered.

As the timing of inflow and outflow of specie money did not always match although this business was done every year cyclically and continuously, when expense was needed before attaining the current money, it was unavoidable to borrow gold and silver from powerful merchants (especially kuramoto [sake brewer] or kakeya [merchants dealing in finance]), putting up their annual rice tax or local special products which were to be sold later as security, and they paid back when such rice tax or products were actually delivered.
sen.cmt: 時制の修正、文法の修正（wereをwasに）余分なセミコロンを削除、「担保として」の訳を修正しました。
sen.e: As the timing of inflow and outflow of specie money did not always match although this business was done every year cyclically and continuously, when expense was needed before attaining the current money, it was unavoidable to borrow gold and silver from powerful merchants (especially kuramoto [sake brewer] or kakeya [merchants dealing in finance]), putting up their annual rice tax or local special products which were to be sold later as security, and they paid back when such rice tax or products were actually delivered.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大名貸は言うなれば、石高制・儒教的農本主義に基づく米納年貢制による歳入制度と商品経済・貨幣経済の発展によって信用経済の発生までみていた貨幣制度による歳出制度の矛盾を補完する制度であった。
sen.e: Daimyogashi can be explained as the system which complements the discrepancy between the annual revenue system that is based on system of Kokudaka (tax system based on rice) and Confucian physiocracy, and annual expenditure system that was even experiencing occurrence of credit economy as a result of the development of commodity economy and monetary economy.

Daimyogashi can be explained as a system which complemented discrepancy between the annual revenue system that was based on the system of Kokudaka (tax system based on rice) and Confucian physiocracy, and annual expenditure system that was even experiencing occurrence of credit economy as a result of the development of commodity economy and monetary economy.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の修正、時制の修正しました。
sen.e: Daimyogashi can be explained as a system which complemented discrepancy between the annual revenue system that was based on the system of Kokudaka (tax system based on rice) and Confucian physiocracy, and annual expenditure system that was even experiencing occurrence of credit economy as a result of the development of commodity economy and monetary economy.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 江戸時代初期には伝統的に有力商人が多かった京都の商人からの借り入れも多かったが、京都自体の経済的地位の低下によって大名貸との関係が薄くなった。
sen.e: Many loans were arranged by merchants in Kyoto as there were traditionally a large number of powerful merchants there in early Edo period, but the connection of Daimyo and Kyoto became weaker as the position of Kyoto in economy declined.

Many loans were arranged by merchants in Kyoto as there were traditionally a large number of powerful merchants there in the early Edo period, but the connection of Daimyo and Kyoto became weaker as the position of Kyoto in economy declined.
sen.cmt: Edo periodの前に冠詞を挿入しました。
sen.e: Many loans were arranged by merchants in Kyoto as there were traditionally a large number of powerful merchants there in the early Edo period, but the connection of Daimyo and Kyoto became weaker as the position of Kyoto in economy declined.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 関東地方・東北地方を中心に江戸商人との取引も行われ、江戸商人による大名貸の例もみられるが、江戸は江戸幕府本体及びその親衛隊として江戸に常住した旗本の年貢米・特産品の売却地でもあり、幕府財政安定を意図した米価維持のための諸藩への廻米制限令が出されることもあり、藩にとっては安定した資金調達先にはなり得なかった（結果的に江戸への米は幕府米・旗本米・商人米が大部分を占め、関東・東北諸藩の年貢米の一部が売却されるのみとなる）。
sen.e: There were some examples of merchants in Edo loaning mainly to Han in Kanto and Tohoku regions, but Edo could not be a stable financial source for Han as merchants in Edo were the people to whom Edo bakufu itself and hatamoto (the direct retainers of the bakufu) in Edo as the guards sold their annual rice tax or special products and sometimes bakufu ordered restriction of rice delivery out of Edo for rice-price keeping operation for bakufu's fiscal stability. (As a result most of rice that were dealt Edo were from Bakufu, Hatamoto, and some merchants, and only partial amount of rice from Han in Kanto region and Tohoku region were dealt.)

There were some examples of Edo merchants who did daimyogashi mainly to domains in the Kanto and the Tohoku regions, but Edo did not become a stable financial source for domains because annual rice tax and special products of the Edo bakufu or hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) who lived in Edo to guard the bakufu were sold in Edo, and sometimes the bakufu ordered restriction of rice delivery out of Edo for rice-price keeping operation for the bakufu's fiscal stability (as a result most of rice that were dealt in Edo were from the bakufu, hatamoto, and some merchants, and only partial amount of rice from domains in the Kanto region and the Tohoku region were dealt).
sen.cmt: 冠詞の修正、「江戸は江戸幕府本体及びその親衛隊として江戸に常住した旗本の年貢米・特産品の売却地でもあり」の部分は書き換え、Hanはdomainに、不要な大文字を削除して小文字に
sen.e: There were some examples of Edo merchants who did daimyogashi mainly to domains in the Kanto and the Tohoku regions, but Edo did not become a stable financial source for domains because annual rice tax and special products of the Edo bakufu or hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) who lived in Edo to guard the bakufu were sold in Edo, and sometimes the bakufu ordered restriction of rice delivery out of Edo for rice-price keeping operation for the bakufu's fiscal stability (as a result most of rice that were dealt in Edo were from the bakufu, hatamoto, and some merchants, and only partial amount of rice from domains in the Kanto region and the Tohoku region were dealt).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 結果的にほとんどの藩が蔵屋敷を設置し、江戸よりも幕府による制約が少ない大坂に資金調達先が求められ、大坂の蔵元・掛屋・両替商などが大名貸の有力な担い手となっていった。
sen.e: As a result, Han sought for financial sources in Osaka, where most Han held their Kurayashiki (warehouse-residence) and there were lesser restrictions from bakufu than Edo, therefore Kuramoto, Kakeya, and Ryogaeshou (merchants in banking business) in Osaka became powerful in Daimyogashi.

As a result, domains sought for financial sources in Osaka, where most domains held their kurayashiki (warehouse-residence) and there were fewer restrictions from the bakufu than Edo, and therefore, kuramoto, kakeya, and ryogaeshou (merchants in banking business) in Osaka became powerful in the Daimyogashi business.
sen.cmt: Hanをdomainに、不要な大文字を削除して小文字に、文法の誤りを訂正（lesserをfewerに）
sen.e: As a result, domains sought for financial sources in Osaka, where most domains held their kurayashiki (warehouse-residence) and there were fewer restrictions from the bakufu than Edo, and therefore, kuramoto, kakeya, and ryogaeshou (merchants in banking business) in Osaka became powerful in the Daimyogashi business.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、大名貸に伴う大坂から江戸への貨幣の流出は、江戸商人による大坂からの物資買付とともに、武士とその生活を支える商工業者による消費都市江戸と「天下の台所」と呼ばれた大坂との間に高度な為替の仕組を生み出す間接的な要因にもなった。
sen.e: Also, outflow on money from Osaka to Edo by Daimyogashi became remote cause of creating a sophisticated system of currency exchange between Edo, consumer city of samurai and people in trade and manufacture who support the life of samurai, and Osaka, city called "the kitchen of Japan", along with Edo merchants buying goods from Osaka.

Also, money outflow from Osaka to Edo due to daimyogashi and Edo merchants buying goods from Osaka became remote causes of creating a sophisticated system of currency exchange between Edo, a consumer city of samurai and people in trade and manufacture who supported lives of samurai, and Osaka, a city called "the kitchen of Japan."
sen.cmt: わかりやすくするためにEdo merchants buying goods from Osakaを冒頭に移動、冠詞の修正
sen.e: Also, money outflow from Osaka to Edo due to daimyogashi and Edo merchants buying goods from Osaka became remote causes of creating a sophisticated system of currency exchange between Edo, a consumer city of samurai and people in trade and manufacture who supported lives of samurai, and Osaka, a city called "the kitchen of Japan."
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 当初は藩財政も比較的規模が小さく財政も安定していたために、素貸にて行われることも珍しくは無かった。
sen.e: It was not rare that Daimyogashi was arranged without interests as finance of Han was secure as its economy was in relatively small scale.
It was not unusual that daimyogashi was arranged without interests because the finance of a domain was secure as its economy was in relatively small scale.
sen.cmt: rareをunusualに、冠詞を修正
sen.e: It was not unusual that daimyogashi was arranged without interests because the finance of a domain was secure as its economy was in relatively small scale.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: だが、江戸時代中期に入ると形状的・臨時的（例勅使・朝鮮通信使の接待や征夷大将軍の日光社参参詣の供奉など）の両面における財政支出の拡大に加えて享保3年（1718年）以後の米価の低落傾向によって財政難に拍車がかかり、恒常的な借り入れ関係が生じ、更に領内の凶作によって蔵屋敷への年貢米（蔵米）や特産品（蔵物）搬入が減少するなどで売却代金によって返済しきれなくなる事態も生じた。
sen.e: However, in the middle of Edo period, Han's financial spending expands, firstly because there were more of formal and special expense required (example: reception of imperial messengers or chosen Tushinsi, envoy from Korea, or accompanying with shogun's visiting to Nikko to recognize their great ancestor), secondly because financial difficulty was accelerated because of tendency of falling rice price after 1718.

However, in the middle of the Edo period, financial spending of domains expanded because there were more formal and special expenses required (for example, receptions of imperial messengers and envoys from Korea, or attendance on the shogun's visit to Nikko to recognize their great ancestor), and their financial difficulty was accelerated because of the declining of rice price in and after 1718.
sen.cmt: 余分なofの削除、「同行」をattendanceに変更、ebvoｙを複数形に、不要な語(firstlyやsecondlyなど）の削除「一原文一訳文の例外対処」のコメントが抜けています。分割処理しているのに日本語原文箇所が分割されていません。
sen.e: However, in the middle of the Edo period, financial spending of domains expanded because there were more formal and special expenses required (for example, receptions of imperial messengers and envoys from Korea, or attendance on the shogun's visit to Nikko to recognize their great ancestor), and their financial difficulty was accelerated because of the declining of rice price in and after 1718.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 結果として、恒常的な借り入れ関係が生じ、更に領内の凶作によって蔵屋敷への年貢米（蔵米）や特産品（蔵物）搬入が減少するなどで売却代金によって返済しきれなくなる事態も生じた。
sen.e: Finally han's finance starts to be constantly in debt, and sometimes the debt could not be repaid when enough sales money was not earned from annual rice tax and local products because of poor harvest in the domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Finally domains started to borrow money constantly, and sometimes their debt could not be paid back when enough sales money was not earned from annual rice tax and local products because of poor harvest in the domain.
sen.cmt: Hanをdomainに、「恒常的な借り入れ関係が生じ」の訳を変更しました
sen.e: Finally domains started to borrow money constantly, and sometimes their debt could not be paid back when enough sales money was not earned from annual rice tax and local products because of poor harvest in the domain.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: それでも不足額を「証文貸」と称して元利金を複数年にわたる売却代金からの分割返済によって行われれば、一応はきちんと返済したものとみなされた。
sen.e: Even so, it was more or less regarded as repaid by calling the balance due "Shomongashi" (a bond loan) and its principal and interests were paid by installments in multi-year.
Even so, it was thought that the debt was more or less repaid when calling the balance due "Shomongashi" (a bond loan) and its principal and interests were paid by installments in multi-year.
sen.cmt: more or lessの位置を変えました。動詞をthink に変更しました。
sen.e: Even so, it was thought that the debt was more or less repaid when calling the balance due "Shomongashi" (a bond loan) and its principal and interests were paid by installments in multi-year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: だが、どの藩も財政難は深刻化する一方であり、藩側による蔵元・掛屋の解任や証文の破棄などによる一方的な債務破棄（踏み倒し）やこれに伴う商人の破産が起きた。
sen.e: However, Han's financial difficulty got worse and worse and some Han started to repudiate their debt by dismissing their Kuramoto or Kakeya or abandoning their bonds, which caused the merchants going bankrupt.

However, every domain's financial difficulty got worse and worse and some domains started to repudiate their debt by dismissing their kuramoto or kakeya or abandoning their bonds, which made merchants bankrupt.
sen.cmt: Hanをdomainに、「これに伴う商人の破産が起きた」の訳を変更しました。「一原文一訳文の例外対処」のコメントが抜けています
sen.e: However, every domain's financial difficulty got worse and worse and some domains started to repudiate their debt by dismissing their kuramoto or kakeya or abandoning their bonds, which made merchants bankrupt.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 反対に中小藩の中には商人側からの取引打切通知を受ける藩も現れた。
sen.e: On the other hand, several Han with relatively small domains received notice of deal termination from merchants.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, some small or medium sized domains received a notice of deal termination from merchants.
sen.cmt: 「中小藩」の訳を変更しました
sen.e: On the other hand, some small or medium sized domains received a notice of deal termination from merchants.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 更に江戸幕府も大名救済と商業抑制のために宝暦11年（1761年）以後、幕府御用金の藩への実質的な貸付や幕命から商人に対して親藩への強制的な貸付命令を行うようになった。
sen.e: Even more, Edo Bakufu started loaning bakufu goyokin (special tax imposed on merchants for bakufu) to han, and ordering merchants to arrange loaning to han that are related to Tokugawa clan after 1761 for saving Daimyo and controlling merchants.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition, in 1761, the Edo bakufu started loaning bakufu goyokin (special tax imposed on merchants for the bakufu) to domains and ordering merchants to arrange loaning to domains that were related to the Tokugawa clan in order to save Daimyo and control merchants.
sen.cmt: 「更に」の訳の変更、冠詞の修正、after 1761の前置詞および位置の変更、時制の修
sen.e: In addition, in 1761, the Edo bakufu started loaning bakufu goyokin (special tax imposed on merchants for the bakufu) to domains and ordering merchants to arrange loaning to domains that were related to the Tokugawa clan in order to save Daimyo and control merchants.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 極端の場合として領内の凶作にも関わらず、貸付の停止を恐れた藩が農民から強制的に徴収して蔵屋敷に送って、同一年の年貢米を担保に複数の商人から融資を受ける例や、返済実績の確保を行ったために蔵屋敷に大量に米が送られているにも関わらず領内は飢饉で餓死者が出るという「飢饉移出」が発生して餓死者の発生に伴って耕作者のいない田畑が発生して更なる財政収入の悪化をもたらして更なる大名貸を依頼するという悪循環が発生した例もあった。
sen.e: There are some extreme cases such as han, in fear of termination of loaning, collected rice from farmers forcibly, sent the rice to Kurayasiki, and arranged finance loan from several merchants by putting the rice as collateral, or Han, giving priority on repaying, sent a large amount of rice to Kurayashiki when people are dying from starvation in the domain, which created bad circulation of more need of arranging Daimyogashi because of worsened financial inflow caused by less farmers on land after starvation.

There were some extreme cases such as an example that domains who were in fear of termination of loaning collected rice from farmers forcibly and sent the rice to their kurayasiki to arrange finance loans from several merchants by putting the rice as security, or another example that domains who were giving priority on repaying sent a large amount of rice to their kurayashiki even though people were dying from starvation in their territories, which created a bad circulation of more need of arranging daimyogashi because of worsened financial inflow caused by less farmers on farmland after starvation.
sen.cmt: 全体的な修正
sen.e: There were some extreme cases such as an example that domains who were in fear of termination of loaning collected rice from farmers forcibly and sent the rice to their kurayasiki to arrange finance loans from several merchants by putting the rice as security, or another example that domains who were giving priority on repaying sent a large amount of rice to their kurayashiki even though people were dying from starvation in their territories, which created a bad circulation of more need of arranging daimyogashi because of worsened financial inflow caused by less farmers on farmland after starvation.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのため、大名貸の危険（リスク）は高くなる一方で、利潤率は低下するようになった。
sen.e: The risk of Daimyogashi was higher and higher when the profit rate got lower.
The risk of daimyogashi became higher and higher although its profit rate became lower.
sen.cmt: 不要な大文字を削除、wasとgotをそれぞれbecameに、whenをalthoughに
sen.e: The risk of daimyogashi became higher and higher although its profit rate became lower.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: だが、慢性的な財政難に苦しむ借手側の藩も勿論のこと、既に多額の貸付を抱えてしまった貸手側の商人も全ての大名貸から手を引けるような状況ではなくなりつつあった。
sen.e: However, it was becoming difficult for merchants to walk away from Daimyogashi because they arranged large amount of loans as well as han who are suffering from chronic financial difficulty.

However, it was very difficult for merchants to walk away from daimyogashi because they already arranged large amount of loans, and it was also hard for domains who were suffering from chronic financial difficulty.

sen.j: このため、借手側の藩は商人に対して扶持米を与えて藩士と同様の待遇を与えるなどの厚遇策によって商人の関係断絶を回避し、貸手側の商人は締貸し・分貸しなどの融資額の制約を設定したり枝手形を発行して投資者を募ることで危険の分散を図った。
sen.e: Therefore, han, the borrower, gave merchants special treatments, such as paying Fuchimai (salary rice) and giving the same treatment as Hanshi, the feudal retainers of domain, and avoided dissociation with merchants, as well as merchants, the lender, tried to scatter the risk by setting limit of credit or issuing sprit bills and raising investors.

sen.j: また、草間直方や石田敬起（大根屋小右衛門）のように藩政改革に助言を行って藩財政の再建に協力することで、自らの持つ債権の踏み倒しを回避しようとする商人も存在した。
